alert.note: Alert for Lafayette; Northern Acadia; St. Landry (Louisiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Lake Charles (Southeast Texas and Southwest Louisiana)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued January 08 at 9:14AM CST by NWS Lake Charles
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT NORTH CENTRAL LAFAYETTE... NORTHEASTERN ACADIA AND CENTRAL ST. LANDRY PARISHES THROUGH 945 AM CST... At 914 AM CST, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Church Point, moving northeast at 45 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to vegetation and outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Opelousas, Carencro, Church Point, Leonville, Palmetto, Sunset, Port Barre, Washington, Grand Coteau, Cankton, Lawtell, and Lebeau. This includes Interstate 49 between mile markers 6 and 34. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
